project_abstract.cdata: The proposed project, the first of its type in Sri Lanka, is aimed at supporting both the food and tree crop sub-sectors. It is designed to support on-going priority Government agricultural rehabilitation and development programs through the provision of imported capital equipment and technical assistance. Support provided would increase agricultural production in the short-term and would lay the foundation for longer-term, more comprehensive development. IDA funds would provide finance for the c.i.f. costs of imported farm tractors, machinery, equipment and transport vehicles (US$18.0 million), and spare parts for farm tractors, earth moving equipment and the coconut processing industry (US$6.5 million). Technical assistance would be provided for pre-investment studies and for improvements in machinery repair facilities (US$0.5 million).
